comments: It seems likely that every number eventually appears in A005210, so this sequence is probably well-defined. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 16 2015
references: Popular Computing (Calabasas, CA), Z-Sequences, Vol. 4 (No. 42, Sep 1976), pp. 12-16.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
Popular Computing (Calabasas, CA), Z-Sequences, continued. Annotated and scanned copy of pages 14, 15, 16, 18 of Vol. 5 (No. 56, Nov 1977).
maple: b:= proc(n) option remember;     `if`(n<3, 1, abs(b(n-1)+2*b(n-2)-n))    end:a:= proc() local t, a; t, a:= 0, proc() -1 end;      proc(n) local h;        while a(n) = -1 do          t:= t+1; h:= b(t);          if a(h) = -1 then a(h):= t fi        od; a(n)      end    end():seq(a(n), n=0..100);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 16 2015
author: _David W. Wilson_
